instruction: 1. Welcome to the mitmproxy tutorial. In this lesson we cover replaying requests.
2. Letâ€™s generate a request that we can replay. We use `curl` in a separate terminal.
3. We now want to replay the this request.
4. Put the focus (`>>`) on the request that should be replayed. This is already the case in our example.
6. Note that no new rows are added for replayed flows, but the existing row is updated.
7. Every time you press `r`, mitmproxy sends this request to the server again and updates the flow.
8. You can also modify a flow before replaying it.
9. It works as shown in the previous lesson, by pressing `e`.
10. Congratulations! You have completed all lessons of the mitmproxy tutorial.
